definition: to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
to hire at a high salary

sentences.english: Experts of foot massage are ready to serve you with 1st class teachnique.
sentences.chinese: 聘请专业沐足技师为您提供一流的服务。

sentences.english: There are many highly-paid managers and entertainers who do not like themselves.
sentences.chinese: 许多被高薪聘请的经理和艺人们都不喜欢他们自己。

sentences.english: They opened for the Alarmists who were celebrating the CD Release of "The Ghost And The Hired Gun".
sentences.chinese: 他们打开了庆祝的鬼CD的释放和聘请枪警告者。

sentences.english: Andy Gallaher, General Manager of Dunkin Donuts UK, was recruited to put that right.
sentences.chinese: 安迪加拉赫总经理老唐甜甜圈英国，聘请了这一权利。

sentences.english: We ony recruit our manpower that has been approved by Local Government Authority.
sentences.chinese: 我们配合当地政府所规定的条例来聘请劳工。

sentences.english: Make them desire you as much as possible before you ask for those big bucks.
sentences.chinese: 在你提出那些大数目之前让他们尽可能的想要聘请你。

sentences.english: We engage you as a legal adviser.
sentences.chinese: 我们聘请你当法律顾问。

sentences.english: The department store hired professional designer to display its goods in the window.
sentences.chinese: 百货商店聘请了专业设计师在其橱窗里陈列商品。

sentences.english: We engaged her as an interpreter.

sentences.chinese: 聘请印度工人，珠宝失踪。

sentences.english: Once it's green-lit, the deals to the actors are made.
sentences.chinese: 一旦绿光闪过，就可以聘请配音演员了。

sentences.english: I have enaged him as my new assistant.
sentences.chinese: 我已经聘请他做我的新助手。

sentences.english: and then the person decides whether they want to hire us or not. So,...yep.
sentences.chinese: 然后别人决定要不要聘请我们。

sentences.english: Is the school SAFEA authorized to employ foreign teachers?
sentences.chinese: 学校是否取得聘请外教资格证？

sentences.english: I will imagine the emperor's craftsmen must be very skillful.
sentences.chinese: 我能想象皇帝聘请的这些工匠都技艺高超。

sentences.english: He engaged her for the position.
sentences.chinese: 他聘请她担任这个职务。

definition: to hire at a high salary
hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
special duty/assigned full time to a task
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)
to select/to detail/to set apart/to appoint
